title: Mother charged after toddler shoots himself in the chest
content:
The mother of a 3-year-old boy who was shot in the chest with a revolver last week faces charges of making the firearm accessible to a child.
Yesenia Cantu, 21, was charged Monday with the Class-A misdemeanor and issued a $10,000 personal recognizance bond by Justice of the Peace Marcos Ochoa.
Cantu’s aunt told Hidalgo County Sheriff’s investigators she was home Saturday night when the 3-year-old got out of a parked car and walked across the street holding the gun.
The aunt, who lives in the 4600 block of Sorita Street near Mission – the same street as Cantu, said she tried to take the gun from the boy when it discharged, shooting the boy in the chest, according to department spokesman J.P. Rodriguez.
Mission Police were first called to a local hospital about 7 p.m. Saturday on reports that a boy arrived to the emergency room suffering from a gunshot wound.
There were other children in the home at the time of the shooting but no other injuries were reported. The boy survived after receiving multiple surgeries, Rodriguez said.
He said Cantu confessed to finding a small caliber handgun in her ex-husband’s car and placing it in the center console of her mother’s car, which she was driving.
“Yesenia doesn’t know if her child saw where she put the gun,” the complaint states. “She didn’t see when it was that her child got the gun out of the car.”
If convicted of making the firearm accessible to a child, a Class-A misdemeanor, Cantu faces up to one year in jail and a $4,000 fine.
